CatDescriptText: Tom Schmidt, 1609 Meadville Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is any racial tension in Pittsburgh? in neighborhood where you live?  If so, what do you think causes it?" answer reads: "There is some racial tension, but not too much.  Some of the incidents are in the high schools among the members of the athletic teams.  I can't exactly say what it is, but it's there."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Tom Schmidt with closed eyes wearing diagonally striped necktie with tie clip, and suit with belt, standing on Wood Street with Dimlings Candy on Liberty Avenue in background, Downtown
